body:
Comment 12: 
I agree with the two binary distribution covers the common case.

But i don't agree very few users need both.

In the Downloads page, go1.1.1.windows-386.zip and go1.1.1.windows-amd64.zip
are download 1200+ and 1100+ times.
If very few users need both, why 386/amd64 download times very nearly?

And i don't agree with Minux's some opinion:

In Minux's some opinion, windows's user don't need msi installer,
and even don't need integration gotour.exe tool.
Because windows's user can also build Go with MinGW from source code.
...

Just for Go windows binary distribution(e.g: go1.1.1.windows-amd64.zip):

I think the binary distribution's features is not complete,
because it can't generate the XP platform's executable program.
It just only include developer's part of the win64 customers,
not include win32 customers.
